results.title: Safety in construction. Part 1. Excavations
results.brief_description: Divided into two sections, the first part of this film shows unsafe situations on an excavation site and the second part shows the accidents that could result and outlines how to avoid them.

results.title: Safe handling of food in quantity
results.creator_credit: Richard Turner and New York State College of Home Economics
results.brief_description: Discusses food poisoning and measures to prevent it for those employed in handling food. Demonstrates control of bacteria by avoiding contamination, temperature regulation and chemical methods.

results.title: Sacred hearts
results.creator_credit: Barbara Rennie, Dee Dee Glass and Reality Productions
results.brief_description: The torment, fear and severe discipline of impressionable schoolgirls at a Catholic orphanage in wartime Britain are brought vividly to the screen in “Sacred hearts”. Sister Thomas, (Anna Massey) is a major contributor to the atmosphere of intellectual, sexual and emotional repression at the convent school, where no signs of affection are tolerated. Excellently acted and constructed, this film exposes some of the myths and rituals which make up our perceptions of convent schools. The cast also includes Katrin Carlidge and Oona Kirsh.

results.title: Rush hour space age
results.creator_credit: Litton Industries and Space Age Images
results.brief_description: What is the solution to the problem of the automobile which is threatening to kill cities and their inhabitants? This film proposes that mass transportation systems are the answer and demonstrates that Chicago, New York and London are doing something about it by improving the efficiency and economy of existing systems. Some must take more drastic action. For Example, San Francisco, has set up a rapid transport system authority to combat the problem. Mention is made of the first automatic public transport ticketing system.

results.title: Rumanian artists
results.brief_description: Presents performances by star singers and instrumentalists of Romania. Some national musical instruments are used in orchestral settings. Includes part of the “Romanian Rhapsody” by Georges Enesco.

results.title: Royal Australian Army Service Corps
results.creator_credit: Department of Army, Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Service Corps, which ranges from the cold stores of Victoria to the Malaya jungle. Presents interesting features such as air-drops in Malaya and the provisioning of Antarctic bases, using landing craft.

results.title: Rowing: a symphony of motion
results.creator_credit: Jerry Murphy, Trin Yarborough and Docufilms
results.brief_description: Surveys the different varieties of rowing from the grace and solitude of the single oarsman to the drive and precision of an eight-oar crew - a parallel of fragile beauty and driving power. Also includes a segment on women in rowing.

results.title: Route des Cimes
results.brief_description: A road tanker’s daily hazardous climb up the snowbound mountainside to the village of Val d’Isere whose hotels, hospitals and homes are dependent upon its cargo for fuel. Contrasting with the upward grind of the tanker are exhilarating scenes of skiers skimming down from the slopes above Val d’Isere, breaking a new trail from the mountain tops to the village.
